scenarioDescription:
The GJ 685 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 685 is a star with 0.55 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.54 times its radius. It is located 46.69 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 685 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 685 system


GJ 685 b

GJ 685 b was discovered by the Qatar observatory, in 2019-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 685 b is 9.006 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 685 b is 2.950 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 685 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 685, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Qatar.
name: GJ 685 - System With 1 Exoplanet
